cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses the issue of posterior collapse in VAE models, which is a common problem in deep learning and machine learning. The paper focuses on the loss surface of deep autoencoder networks and how it can lead to bad local minima, which can cause the VAE to behave like an aggressive truncation operator. This topic is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), computer vision (cs.CV), neural networks (cs.NE), and systems and control (cs.SY).
